metadata.title: CVE-2013-3564 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The web interface in VideoLAN VLC media player before 2.0.7 has no accesscontrol which allows remote attackers to view directory listings via the'dir' command or issue other commands without authenticating.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-3564` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
libvlc5 - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
libvlccore9 - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-bin - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-data - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-l10n - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
vlc-plugin-zvbi - 3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vlc package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.8-0ubuntu18.04.1').
